dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain 169 (121b 8x4 11x6 187m) SR: 139.66

dismissalComment.html: and he is going to finish level with BC Lara on 169 as his blinder of an innings finally comes to an end as he looks to clear Al-Amin, who is looking for the blockhole once more, but just can't get enough on it to clear the fielder stationed just before the rope, as this one flies directly to him. Ramdin is kicking himself, but he has more than done his job today for his country. Has really set up West Indies beautifully here

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo c Imrul Kayes b Mahmudullah 124 (127b 7x4 8x6 159m) SR: 97.63

dismissalComment.html: slows it up as he sees the batsman advancing and that makes Bravo miscue, to point. He was running out of juice anyway, which was why he tried to hit everything out of the park. Terrific innings from Lil B

and Al-Amin gets his man as he bowls one on a fantastic line as this just shapes away from Gayle on a middle line, with the batsman guilty of hanging his bat as the ball catches the outside edge to offer a simple chance behind to Mushfiqur, who snaps it up gleefully. Al-Amin is pumped and Bangladesh are sniffing some early blood here

going for the wide yorker but gets his length slightly off as this is converted into a low full toss outside off, but luckily for Al-Amin, Sammy struggles to get this away as this ends up spooning high over to deep extra-cover, who is able to get under it to take a smart catch. West Indies looking to hit out in these final overs as Bangladesh seek desperately for a modicum of control on the scoring rate

and he is going to finish level with BC Lara on 169 as his blinder of an innings finally comes to an end as he looks to clear Al-Amin, who is looking for the blockhole once more, but just can't get enough on it to clear the fielder stationed just before the rope, as this one flies directly to him. Ramdin is kicking himself, but he has more than done his job today for his country. Has really set up West Indies beautifully here

and his stay at the crease ends as quickly as it began as he pretty much follows Ramdin to the pavilion with a similar-looking shot that is picked up by the same, exact fielder, as the one Ramdin found before, and all of a sudden Al-Amin is now on a hat-trick with two balls left

slows it up as he sees the batsman advancing and that makes Bravo miscue, to point. He was running out of juice anyway, which was why he tried to hit everything out of the park. Terrific innings from Lil B

dismissalText.commentary: Lendl Simmons c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: far too soon for those kinds of shots, even if the pitch seems terribly inviting to the batsmen. Simmons, slotted in to open for the first time for the series, rushes down the pitch and goes for the heave ho. Miscues it and offers a skier to mid-off

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Al-Amin Hossain 6 (17b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 35.29

dismissalComment.html: and Al-Amin gets his man as he bowls one on a fantastic line as this just shapes away from Gayle on a middle line, with the batsman guilty of hanging his bat as the ball catches the outside edge to offer a simple chance behind to Mushfiqur, who snaps it up gleefully. Al-Amin is pumped and Bangladesh are sniffing some early blood here

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard c Tamim Iqbal b Abdur Razzak 10 (7b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 142.85

dismissalComment.html: holes out at long-on, but there are no celebrations, prompting a few people to doubt if the catch was taken. This was flighted on middle and leg, Pollard wound up for the big hit but didn't put enough muscled behind it.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Abdur Razzak b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Daren Sammy c Abdur Razzak b Al-Amin Hossain 10 (9b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: going for the wide yorker but gets his length slightly off as this is converted into a low full toss outside off, but luckily for Al-Amin, Sammy struggles to get this away as this ends up spooning high over to deep extra-cover, who is able to get under it to take a smart catch. West Indies looking to hit out in these final overs as Bangladesh seek desperately for a modicum of control on the scoring rate

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sammy b Rampaul 72 (113b 8x4 0x6 146m) SR: 63.71

dismissalComment.html: and Mushfiqur's vigil finally comes to an end as he looks for some quick runs over square leg, hitting this fuller delivery from Rampaul to Darren Sammy, who takes a good, safe catch. With this wicket, West Indies will feel even more secure in their position

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Narine 55 (62b 9x4 0x6 92m) SR: 88.7

dismissalComment.html: chose the wrong ball to cut. That was ducking back in at him, it was the knuckle ball that skids off the turf, takes the bottom edge and crashes into the sticks

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Oh my, oh my! That is an absolute stunner. Roach almost defied gravity for a moment as he hung in mid-air, stuck out his right hand, and plucked a mistimed pull at mid on to complete a mesmerising catch. Fantastic athleticism on display here as Bangladesh go two down very early in the piece

and Mushfiqur's vigil finally comes to an end as he looks for some quick runs over square leg, hitting this fuller delivery from Rampaul to Darren Sammy, who takes a good, safe catch. With this wicket, West Indies will feel even more secure in their position

and he strikes straightaway, taking the useful wicket of Nasir as he looked to deposit Rampaul back over his head into the stands, but only succeeds in lifting this one high and handsome, with Kemar Roach coming round from long on to complete the catch

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'im! full and fast and on target and all Rampaul needed was for Gazi to miss, which he does as he looks to blast this out of St Kitts. Gazi, however, is unmoved as they await the no-ball replay. Rampaul looks safe, but only just, as he has a little bit of his boot behind the line upon impact

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: chose the wrong ball to cut. That was ducking back in at him, it was the knuckle ball that skids off the turf, takes the bottom edge and crashes into the sticks

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Sammy b Holder 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: perfect start for the West Indies, this straightens off a good length and forces Anamul to hang his bat. The edge sails through to second slip. He was rooted to the crease and felt for the ball, which led to his downfall

Roach almost defied gravity for a moment as he hung in mid-air, stuck out his right hand, and plucked a mistimed pull at mid on to complete a mesmerising catch. dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Sammy b DJ Bravo 5 (13b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 38.46

dismissalComment.html: one flash too many and this time the outside edge is thick enough to carry to first slip. They've been probing outside his off stump ever since he got to the crease, he's had problems there in the recent past and has become his downfall again

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sammy b Rampaul 72 (113b 8x4 0x6 146m) SR: 63.71

dismissalComment.html: and Mushfiqur's vigil finally comes to an end as he looks for some quick runs over square leg, hitting this fuller delivery from Rampaul to Darren Sammy, who takes a good, safe catch. With this wicket, West Indies will feel even more secure in their position

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c †Ramdin b Roach 27 (38b 2x4 1x6 65m) SR: 71.05

dismissalComment.html: good slower ball by Roach, this one well outside off, as Mahmudullah is guilty of following this one as he goes for a half-hearted cut, hoping to get this through the slip region, but instead manages a thick outside edge which is taken by Ramdin. West Indies four wickets away now from wrapping this up

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Roach b Rampaul 26 (28b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: and he strikes straightaway, taking the useful wicket of Nasir as he looked to deposit Rampaul back over his head into the stands, but only succeeds in lifting this one high and handsome, with Kemar Roach coming round from long on to complete the catch

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi b Rampaul 24 (26b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'im! full and fast and on target and all Rampaul needed was for Gazi to miss, which he does as he looks to blast this out of St Kitts. Gazi, however, is unmoved as they await the no-ball replay. Rampaul looks safe, but only just, as he has a little bit of his boot behind the line upon impact

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: slaps this one pitched wide of off stump down to long on to bring the match to an end

commentPostTextItems.html: And there you have it folks, West Indies go into the T20 on the back of three wins on the bounce, while Bangladesh once again return to the drawing board as they look to concoct a recipe for success. It is a new series, so a fresh start would certainly be appreciated by both the players and management. We hope you will join us for what promises to be an exciting encounter on the 27th. Till then, this is Rohan Sharma, on behalf of Alagappan Muthu and the scorers Thilak Ram and S Balasubramanian, saying good night and good luck!
Denesh Ramdin has been adjudged Man of the Series

Dwayne Bravo, West Indies captain: It is a great team effort. Happy to win this series 3-0. Congratulations to the entire team, the management, all the other guys. 3-0 is a better result than 2-1. Special congrats for Darren Bravo and Denesh Ramdin on their hundreds today. The guys are hungry for success and that is very important. When we sit down to discuss our team plans we have always discussed how important it is to be consistent and to play the brand of cricket that we are capable of. We now look forward to the T20 game, and we hope to come with the same attitude. Not much is going to change as we are hungry for success. We want to keep putting on a good team effort going forward. We look forward to great things ahead.

Mushfiqur Rahim, Bangladesh captain: I thought they bowled really well up front (Bangladesh), but the way they scored 300 it was always going to be difficult. I thought they were too good on the day. There is a lot of work to be done before the T20 as we need to come up with some good plans for these short boundaries and big hitters. I thought Anamul played really well in the first match, and then Tamim really played well today.

Denesh Ramdin, Man of the Match: Dwayne said he needed someone to bat through the innings and I put my hand up. Darren helped me get there and rotate the strike and hit some boundaries on the way. Bangladesh's seamers bowled well early, then Darren took over and then finally I took over to look for quick runs. Spending time on the golf course may have helped with my good form! I just try to give myself time in the middle and not look to hit too hard in the nets. Was never thinking about the record (highest ODI score for WI batsman).
Denesh Ramdin is the Man of the Match for his 169
We will be back shortly for quotes from the match presentation

The West Indies on the other hand couldn't have asked for a better result for this series. Their batsmen have found form at a crucial time, especially the likes of Darren Bravo and Denesh Ramdin. Rampaul was the pick of the bowlers with 4 for 29 in his ten overs.

Bangladesh will be plenty pleased with how they managed to stick it out, despite never coming close to eclipsing this massive total. With the manner in which they collapsed in the second ODI, this has been a huge improvement, and should bode well for them as they enter the lone T20 on the 27th.
Another big win for the West Indies as this one peters out to a 91-run victory for the Caribbean party, with a 3-0 series whitewash sealed, their third in only 22 years.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: bowls one which spins away as Razzak once again looks to clear the field, but is late on it as it spins away
just stand and deliver as Razzak just bludgeons this through the line through extra-cover for four
almost yorker-length from Gayle as this one is drilled to long on
misses the slog sweep and gets hit on the pad, Razzak wants the run but Mortaza says no
what a time to bowl a wide! The keeper couldn't do much about it as it was fired down the leg side

commentPreTextItems.html: Final over now. Can West Indies pluck out two and bowl out Bangladesh before their final 50 overs?

commentTextItems.html: not the best start if that is their aim as Mortaza creates room by backing away to this ball pitched up to him as he smashes this over the head of Gayle for a six over long on
finishes off his ten-over spell with a beautiful back of a length ball which shapes away upon pitching as this flies to the keeper behind

commentPostTextItems.html: jeff: "Sammy is the insurance policy he comes in lower down if needed or bowls if the 5th bowler fails. "

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: In steps the experienced campaigner, Abdur Razzak

commentTextItems.html: going round the wicket to Razzak as this is delivered up and near the off stump, with Razzak playing back towards the bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi b Rampaul 24 (26b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 92.3

commentTextItems.html: bowled 'im! full and fast and on target and all Rampaul needed was for Gazi to miss, which he does as he looks to blast this out of St Kitts. Gazi, however, is unmoved as they await the no-ball replay. Rampaul looks safe, but only just, as he has a little bit of his boot behind the line upon impact
plays this one from the crease

up in the blockhole as Sohag gets some willow on it before setting off for a quick single as the ball rolls to the off side. The throw coming in manages to hit the stumps at the non-striker's, but his bat didn't come down in time, and he would have been given out if someone had appealed, but no one appealed, and that is a lesson learned young'uns . Mortaza fortunate to get away with that one
follows the batsman as he looks to back away to create room. Ends up digging this one out successfully
full on the leg stump, flicked to backward square leg

commentPostTextItems.html: BajanJonathan: "I don't think people are giving West Indies enough credit. Sure Bangladesh has been disappointing but WI have played very well and dominated all 3 games and deserve this 3-0 win."

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: lifts this awkwardly past short fine leg with one hand on the bat. Very agricultural from Mortaza

commentPreTextItems.html: sue: "Wot is the role of Sammy in the team? Has he been considered Specialist batsman......after loosing the captainship...."

commentTextItems.html: dances down to this one floated on leg, but Gazi ends up hitting this behind square on the leg side
once again looks for the big hit over the leg side, but doesn't quite get enough on it. Still manages to sneak a single though
tossed up on middle and leg as Mortaza clears his front leg to slog sweep Gayle behind square to the deep fine leg boundary
Gazi manages to whip this one through deep midwicket for a single
just a bit of shape back into the right-hander on this good length delivery, glanced to fine leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Basil: "Shoudn't the match be awarded to WIndies once the RRR goes above 36?"

dismissalComment.html: far too soon for those kinds of shots, even if the pitch seems terribly inviting to the batsmen. Simmons, slotted in to open for the first time for the series, rushes down the pitch and goes for the heave ho. Miscues it and offers a skier to mid-off

and Al-Amin gets his man as he bowls one on a fantastic line as this just shapes away from Gayle on a middle line, with the batsman guilty of hanging his bat as the ball catches the outside edge to offer a simple chance behind to Mushfiqur, who snaps it up gleefully. Al-Amin is pumped and Bangladesh are sniffing some early blood here

going for the wide yorker but gets his length slightly off as this is converted into a low full toss outside off, but luckily for Al-Amin, Sammy struggles to get this away as this ends up spooning high over to deep extra-cover, who is able to get under it to take a smart catch. West Indies looking to hit out in these final overs as Bangladesh seek desperately for a modicum of control on the scoring rate

and he is going to finish level with BC Lara on 169 as his blinder of an innings finally comes to an end as he looks to clear Al-Amin, who is looking for the blockhole once more, but just can't get enough on it to clear the fielder stationed just before the rope, as this one flies directly to him. Ramdin is kicking himself, but he has more than done his job today for his country. Has really set up West Indies beautifully here

and his stay at the crease ends as quickly as it began as he pretty much follows Ramdin to the pavilion with a similar-looking shot that is picked up by the same, exact fielder, as the one Ramdin found before, and all of a sudden Al-Amin is now on a hat-trick with two balls left

dismissalComment.html: holes out at long-on, but there are no celebrations, prompting a few people to doubt if the catch was taken. This was flighted on middle and leg, Pollard wound up for the big hit but didn't put enough muscled behind it.

slows it up as he sees the batsman advancing and that makes Bravo miscue, to point. He was running out of juice anyway, which was why he tried to hit everything out of the park. Terrific innings from Lil B

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Al-Amin Hossain 6 (17b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 35.29

dismissalComment.html: and Al-Amin gets his man as he bowls one on a fantastic line as this just shapes away from Gayle on a middle line, with the batsman guilty of hanging his bat as the ball catches the outside edge to offer a simple chance behind to Mushfiqur, who snaps it up gleefully. Al-Amin is pumped and Bangladesh are sniffing some early blood here

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo c Imrul Kayes b Mahmudullah 124 (127b 7x4 8x6 159m) SR: 97.63

dismissalComment.html: slows it up as he sees the batsman advancing and that makes Bravo miscue, to point. He was running out of juice anyway, which was why he tried to hit everything out of the park. Terrific innings from Lil B

dismissalComment.html: going for the wide yorker but gets his length slightly off as this is converted into a low full toss outside off, but luckily for Al-Amin, Sammy struggles to get this away as this ends up spooning high over to deep extra-cover, who is able to get under it to take a smart catch. West Indies looking to hit out in these final overs as Bangladesh seek desperately for a modicum of control on the scoring rate

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain 169 (121b 8x4 11x6 187m) SR: 139.66

dismissalComment.html: and he is going to finish level with BC Lara on 169 as his blinder of an innings finally comes to an end as he looks to clear Al-Amin, who is looking for the blockhole once more, but just can't get enough on it to clear the fielder stationed just before the rope, as this one flies directly to him. Ramdin is kicking himself, but he has more than done his job today for his country. Has really set up West Indies beautifully here

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and his stay at the crease ends as quickly as it began as he pretty much follows Ramdin to the pavilion with a similar-looking shot that is picked up by the same, exact fielder, as the one Ramdin found before, and all of a sudden Al-Amin is now on a hat-trick with two balls left

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Narine 55 (62b 9x4 0x6 92m) SR: 88.7

dismissalComment.html: chose the wrong ball to cut. That was ducking back in at him, it was the knuckle ball that skids off the turf, takes the bottom edge and crashes into the sticks

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Sammy b Holder 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: perfect start for the West Indies, this straightens off a good length and forces Anamul to hang his bat. The edge sails through to second slip. He was rooted to the crease and felt for the ball, which led to his downfall

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Roach b Rampaul 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Oh my, oh my! That is an absolute stunner. Roach almost defied gravity for a moment as he hung in mid-air, stuck out his right hand, and plucked a mistimed pull at mid on to complete a mesmerising catch. Fantastic athleticism on display here as Bangladesh go two down very early in the piece

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sammy b Rampaul 72 (113b 8x4 0x6 146m) SR: 63.71

dismissalComment.html: and Mushfiqur's vigil finally comes to an end as he looks for some quick runs over square leg, hitting this fuller delivery from Rampaul to Darren Sammy, who takes a good, safe catch. With this wicket, West Indies will feel even more secure in their position

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Sammy b DJ Bravo 5 (13b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 38.46

dismissalComment.html: one flash too many and this time the outside edge is thick enough to carry to first slip. They've been probing outside his off stump ever since he got to the crease, he's had problems there in the recent past and has become his downfall again

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c †Ramdin b Roach 27 (38b 2x4 1x6 65m) SR: 71.05

dismissalComment.html: good slower ball by Roach, this one well outside off, as Mahmudullah is guilty of following this one as he goes for a half-hearted cut, hoping to get this through the slip region, but instead manages a thick outside edge which is taken by Ramdin. West Indies four wickets away now from wrapping this up

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Roach b Rampaul 26 (28b 3x4 0x6 34m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: and he strikes straightaway, taking the useful wicket of Nasir as he looked to deposit Rampaul back over his head into the stands, but only succeeds in lifting this one high and handsome, with Kemar Roach coming round from long on to complete the catch

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi b Rampaul 24 (26b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'im! full and fast and on target and all Rampaul needed was for Gazi to miss, which he does as he looks to blast this out of St Kitts. Gazi, however, is unmoved as they await the no-ball replay. Rampaul looks safe, but only just, as he has a little bit of his boot behind the line upon impact

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza not out 15 (9b 1x4 1x6 15m) SR: 166.66

notes: West Indies innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 30 runs, 2 wickets)
West Indies: 50 runs in 13.3 overs (81 balls), Extras 1
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 65 balls (DM Bravo 24, D Ramdin 25, Ex 1)
Drinks: West Indies - 64/2 in 17.0 overs (DM Bravo 25, D Ramdin 26)
West Indies: 100 runs in 21.2 overs (128 balls), Extras 2
D Ramdin: 50 off 45 balls (3 x 4, 3 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 107 balls (DM Bravo 43, D Ramdin 55, Ex 2)
DM Bravo: 50 off 68 balls (4 x 4, 3 x 6)
West Indies: 150 runs in 27.5 overs (167 balls), Extras 6
3rd Wicket: 150 runs in 154 balls (DM Bravo 76, D Ramdin 68, Ex 6)
West Indies: 200 runs in 34.3 overs (207 balls), Extras 6
Drinks: West Indies - 207/2 in 35.0 overs (DM Bravo 93, D Ramdin 96)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 38 runs, 0 wicket)
3rd Wicket: 200 runs in 191 balls (DM Bravo 96, D Ramdin 98, Ex 6)
D Ramdin: 100 off 90 balls (6 x 4, 5 x 6)
DM Bravo: 100 off 112 balls (7 x 4, 6 x 6)
West Indies: 250 runs in 40.2 overs (242 balls), Extras 6
3rd Wicket: 250 runs in 221 balls (DM Bravo 118, D Ramdin 125, Ex 7)
West Indies: 300 runs in 44.3 overs (267 balls), Extras 8
D Ramdin: 150 off 107 balls (8 x 4, 10 x 6)
Innings Break: West Indies - 338/7 in 50.0 overs (DJ Bravo 3, SP Narine 0)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 41 runs, 2 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 10.4 overs (64 balls), Extras 0
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (Tamim Iqbal 30, Mushfiqur Rahim 21, Ex 0)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 77/2 in 16.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 44, Mushfiqur Rahim 29)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 53 balls (9 x 4)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 21.4 overs (131 balls), Extras 3
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 73 balls (6 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 33.6 overs (206 balls), Extras 8
Drinks: Bangladesh - 150/4 in 34.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 66, Mahmudullah 15)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 21 runs, 1 wicket)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 68 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 28, Mahmudullah 16, Ex 6)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 43.6 overs (266 balls), Extras 11

milestones.description: Denesh Ramdin and Darren Bravo's 258-run partnership is the highest for the 3rd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 238 between Hashim Amla and de Villiers
Denesh Ramdin and Darren Bravo's 258-run partnership is WI's highest for the 3rd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 195 between Greenidge and Larry Gomes
Chris Gayle has scored 66 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for WI breaking Brian Lara's record
Tamim Iqbal has scored 30 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record
This is the highest match aggregate (585) involving teams West Indies & Bangladesh in ODIs
Denesh Ramdin and Darren Bravo's 258-run partnership is WI's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 226 between Chanderpaul and Carl Hooper

stories.title: Ramdin, Bravo centuries flay Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: Denesh Ramdin, Darren Bravo centuries flay Bangladesh
stories.summary: Centuries from Denesh Ramdin and Darren Bravo damaged what remained of Bangladesh's confidence and sealed a 3-0 whitewash

image.caption: Darren Bravo and Denesh Ramdin put on the highest third-wicket stand in ODIs
image.longCaption: Darren Bravo and Denesh Ramdin put on the highest third-wicket stand in ODIs, West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Basseterre, St Kitts, August 26, 2014

stories.title: 'We're building towards the World Cup' - Bravo
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: 'We're building towards the World Cup' - Bravo
stories.summary: West Indies captain Dwayne Bravo has already shifted focus to the 2015 World Cup after having the ODI series against Bangladesh in the bag with a match to spare

image.caption: Dwayne Bravo was all smiles after West Indies' big win
image.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo was all smiles after West Indies' big win, West Indies v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, St George's, Grenada, August 22, 2014

stories.title: What's the solution to Bangladesh's collapsing problem?
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: What's the solution to Bangladesh's collapsing problem?
stories.summary: The Bangladesh team has been going down together all too often of late and needs to find a reliable solution to the issue; perhaps the biggest change needed to stall this worrying trend has to be made in the mind?

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal is bowled
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal is bowled, Bangladesh v Hong Kong, World T20, Group A, Chittagong, March 20, 2014

stories.title: Bangladesh face uphill battle to salvage pride
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh face uphill battle to salvage pride
stories.summary: After the debacle in the second ODI in Grenada where they were shot out for 70, Bangladesh will look to avoid yet another series defeat in the final ODI

image.caption: Sunil Narine claimed 3 for 13 in seven overs
image.longCaption: Sunil Narine claimed 3 for 13 in seven overs, West Indies v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, St George's, Grenada, August 22, 2014

stories.title: Ramdin, Bravo centuries flay Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: Denesh Ramdin, Darren Bravo centuries flay Bangladesh
stories.summary: Centuries from Denesh Ramdin and Darren Bravo damaged what remained of Bangladesh's confidence and sealed a 3-0 whitewash

stories.title: 'We're building towards the World Cup' - Bravo
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: 'We're building towards the World Cup' - Bravo
stories.summary: West Indies captain Dwayne Bravo has already shifted focus to the 2015 World Cup after having the ODI series against Bangladesh in the bag with a match to spare

image.caption: Dwayne Bravo was all smiles after West Indies' big win

videos.title: 'Mushfiqur still the ideal captain' - Jurgensen
videos.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts

recentPreviewStory.title: Bangladesh face uphill battle to salvage pride
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh face uphill battle to salvage pride
recentPreviewStory.summary: After the debacle in the second ODI in Grenada where they were shot out for 70, Bangladesh will look to avoid yet another series defeat in the final ODI
